All Implemented Interfaces:
IDReferenced
public class GeoCircle
extends GeoShape

This class is intended for storing circles such as those that make up cartograms

Version:
0.6.3 11 October 1999
Author:
Jamaes Macgill

getPoints

public java.util.Vector getPoints()
Description copied from class: GeoShape
Gets a full list of all the points that make up this shape. For Polygons and rectangles this would be the vertecis, for circles it would be the center point.
Overrides:
getPoints in class GeoShape
Following copied from class: uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.GeoShape
Returns:
A Vector of GeoPoints for each point of this shape

isContainedBy

public boolean isContainedBy(GeoCircle c)

isContainedBy

public boolean isContainedBy(GeoShape container)
Description copied from class: GeoShape
Test to see if this shape is inside another shape. This should only be true if the entire of the shape appears to be inside the shape. In this implementation, every point must be inside of container.
Overrides:
isContainedBy in class GeoShape
Following copied from class: uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.GeoShape
Parameters:
s - The GeoShape to be inside of.
Returns:
A boolean, true if this shape is inside container.
